newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Hengli to float A shares in Shenzhen.
newsitem.headline: Hengli to float A shares in Shenzhen.

text.p: Yueyang Hengli Air-conditioner Co Ltd has been given the go-ahead by the Shenzhen bourse to list 10 million A shares and three million staff shares in Shenzhen next Wednesday, a company spokesman said on Friday.

The A shares were issued at 5.98 yuan ($0.72) each in October, and the employee shares were offered at one yuan per share in 1993, the official told the Hong Kong-based newsletter, the China Securities Bulletin.
All of the shares would be for domestic investors.
The public portion of the offer would have a price-to- earnings ratio of 15.7 times based on estimated net profits of 0.38 yuan per share for 1996, the spokesman added.
Shanghai Shenyin & Wanguo Securities has been appointed Hengli's listing promoter, the official said.
Hengli, which produces air-conditioners for buses and cars, said in its prospectus it would use proceeds to expand its core operations and revamp production facilities and technology.

Hengli, based in the city of Yueyang in central China's Hunan province, said it has forecast net earnings of 19.79 million yuan for this year, compared with 7.45 million yuan in 1995 and 3.79 million yuan a year earlier.
